Pathways is a new program this year that all students are expected to participate in every morning (M-F) from 9:00-9:45 am.
.
.
Each Pathways group is composed of mixed grade level scholars and 2-3 teachers and staff members.
.
.
Our intention is to create close bonds within the Pathway “wolf dens,” and the staff and students will cycle together until students graduate. 🖤🖤🖤
.
.
Activities such as Mindful Mondays, Career & College Thursdays, and Fun Fridays are intended to help IDEA scholars build out their goals and expectations for themselves while bonding with the other students in their dens.🎉🥳📚
.
#Pathways #FunFriday #DistanceLearning

FREE coding camp for middle schoolers!
.
.
virtual camp will be a creative and exciting way to let your scholar explore one of the hottest-growing career paths of the future! The camp will end with a showcase where your scholar will show of their new skills.
.

COST: Free!
.
.

post_text:
Happy Juneteenth! 💥💥🇺🇸✊🏽
.
.
Juneteenth, it is a commemoration of the day that slaves in Texas learned of their freedom. While President Abraham Lincoln proclaimed the emancipation of slaves on January 1, 1863, many slave owners ignored the order. However, on June 19, 1865 Union general Gordon Granger read federal orders to the last known Confederate slaves, freeing them two and a half years after the Emancipation Proclamation was signed. Imagine, years after slavery ended, they did not know that they were free.
.
.
The best way to honor our ancestors on this day is to take good care of ourselves & our community, and to support Black-owned businesses.
.
.
#Juneteenth #History #AmericanHistory

Our Civil Rights journey with @tmapchs_dc continues.
.
.
We recently travelled from Jackson, MS to Memphis, TN, stopping along the way in Indianola, MS - the birthplace of B.B King.
.
.

.

.
.
